t: For the choir director. A psalm of David.
Happy*pn is one who is considerate of the poor; the*ln Lord*s will save him in a day of adversity.
The*ln Lord*s will keep him and preserve him; he*ln will be blessed in the land. You*ln will not give him over to the desire of his enemies.
The*ln Lord*s will sustain him on his sickbed; you*ln will heal him on the bed where he lies.
I*pn said, “Lord,*s be gracious to me; heal*ln me, for I have sinned against you.”
My*ln enemies speak maliciously about me: “When*ln will he die and be forgotten?”
When*ln one of them comes to visit, he speaks deceitfully; he*ln stores up evil in his heart; he*ln goes out and talks.
All*ln who hate me whisper together about me; they*ln plan to harm me.
“Something*ln awful has overwhelmed him, and*ln he won’t rise again from where he lies!”
Even*ln my friend in whom I trusted, one*ln who ate my bread, has*ln raised his heel against me.
But*pn you, Lord,*s be gracious to me and raise me up; then*ln I will repay them.
By*ln this I know that you delight in me: my*ln enemy does not shout in triumph over me.
You*ln supported me because of my integrity and*ln set me in your presence forever.
Blessed*pn be the Lord*s God of Israel, from*ln everlasting to everlasting. Amen*ln and amen.
